replies.body:
To answer the title, if a player doesn't get reported they won't be reviewed, so if someone is doing something bad, please report them. The community decides what should be punished and what shouldn't by what we choose to report or not, so if you see negative behaviour and choose not to report it, you're saying you're ok with that sort of behaviour.

As for your punishment, a 10 game chat restriction is the first tier of punishment. In essence it is a warning that you are falling on the side of negative and need to lean up your act. Failing to do so will see you receive more punishments, through 25 game chat restriction, 14 day ban, and ultimately permanent suspension of your account.

As for your logs, you got a little homophobic for one, and you have a negative attitude pretty much from the third line on. I'm not saying your behaviour was serious, because it wasn't, but there's two things you have remember about this. The first is that this is a warning that you are starting to get yourself in trouble,  a minor punishment for a minor offense to hopefully prevent the start of worse behaviour. The second is that the behaviour of others does not excuse your own. If someone is abusing me all game, that does not then give me the right to abuse them back.

If someone is being negative, mute and report. You only hurt your sanity, your skill/focus, and everyone else on your team by retaliating, and open yourself up to punishment as well. SO long as you report them their behaviour will be reviewed the same as yours was.

You are judged on your own behaviour not the behaviour of others. You'd also normally get more than one games worth of logs for a punishment like this so maybe take a look?

If you want to appeal the restriction you can submit a ticket to player support, but I wouldn't get your hopes up.

Yeah, Riot will not accept an appeal for what you said HeauxzUchiha. They rarely ever revoke a restriction unless it is unlawful.

Your best bet is to wait out the restriction as it is only 10 games. Think of it as a learning curve and learn from your mistakes. Muting them and not retaliating is the first step to avoid being punished.

It's like Seras Dragon stated, your judged on you own actions. What you may not feel is discrimination may feel like it to your team mates. 

If you wish I can go over your chat log and explain why you got this restriction then maybe you will understand the reasoning behind it.
